content.description: This is to the right of Your Mom, two routes to the right of Triple Token.  Another good beginner lead or warmup
ok features, awkward start.
content.location: second to last route on the wall.

content.description: Climb up the bolts on this one past a big bulge to big holds and an easy top-out to anchors. There are several ways to move past the bulge one is to use the big side pull out left to pull over the bulge another uses crimps on the right side of the bulge. 10d/11-
content.location: to the left of Triple Technique.

content.description: Sit start on the lil boulder next to it
content.location: Same boulder Choss Boss is on

content.description: Exceptional first lead for a beginner, HUGE holds the entire way with a low crux on a hanging start.
content.protection: 4 bolts, plus an anchor at the top
content.location: Follow the bolt line to the climber's right of Triple Technique, and just left around a corner.

content.description: Climb up the obvious usually dirty crack to the right of The Wasp. Though this route gets dirty it is a good trad lead.
content.location: To the right of The Wasp.

content.description: Has one bolt but I wouldn't trust it. Best Choice is to go up and set up your own anchor for top rope.
content.protection: One bolt at the top but its pretty sketchy looking.

content.description: Climbs up the obvious overhung crack. Start off on dirty blocky holds to gain the crack. Move through the crack by pocket holds or hand jams to easy climbing above the overhang. Watch out for HUGE SPIDERS and god know what else if you climb it in the summer. Hint- there is a funky sit down rest halfway up this climb. Trust me its there.
content.protection: Natural pro with at least one big piece for the wide crack above. No anchors-  Either walk off or rap down to retrieve your gear.
content.location: The big crack to the right of Tafoni crack

content.description: Start off on huge holds up steep rock. Climb past a bulgy/layback move to easy rock above. Some of the rock seems a little chossy so beware.
content.protection: Natural pro/ Belay from tree or walk off
content.location: First crack on the left side of Tafoni Wall.

content.description: Starts to the right of Lincoln it up. Fairly newly bolted but has probably been TR'd before. Climb up on big holds to a huge lunge or dyno to another big hold. Then on big edges to the anchors. Can be made easier by moving right under 1st bolt.
content.protection: Bolts/Same anchors as Lincoln it Up
content.location: to the right of Lincoln it UP

climbs.name: The Quest for the Sticky Stuff

content.description:
This climb stars off next to a big boulder and climbs up a face on big holds before climbing out a small roof. Great climb that may feel harder than 5.9 but a good sequence through the roof makes it easier.

 For more info on the route, crag and area pick up a copy of Rock Climbing Arkansas guide book amzn.to/1nu9OBL
content.protection: 4 bolts glue in bolts with two glue in anchors. The anchors could use some quick links and or chains for easier cleaning.
content.location: First bolted climb to the right of Gurly Man

content.description:
Starts to the right of the little cave like depression in the wall. Climb up a steep face with the crux guarding the anchors. An easier start goes out left of the cave a bit then back right.

 Moderate movement up to a dyno to the ledge the anchors are to your right. If you on the shorter side of climber there's great is some enjoyable technical bata. For more info on the route, crag and area pick up a copy of Rock Climbing Arkansas guide book http://amzn.to/1nu9OBL
content.location: To the right of "The quest for the stick stuff"

content.description: Shares the start with "Arrowhead Direct - V7." Stand start on left angling crimps and follow the line up left to the arete. Pull around and walk up, or hop down.
content.protection: A pad or two. It's low to the ground, but the landing isn't ideal.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as "Arrowhead - V6." Look for the obvious left leaning line of crimps on the left side of the face.

content.description: This short route starts on top of a boulder and climbs over dirty, blocky edges.  The crux is about 3/4 of the way up where the ledges become a little spread out and they are completely covered in sandy dirt.
content.protection: Anchors have hangers only, no rap rings or chains.
content.location: Route starts on a large boulder and marks the beginning of the Wasp Wall.

content.description: The crux starts with the first few moves at the bottom. Begin with a sit start
content.location: Its the immediate route left of the painted 14.

content.description: This is a unique route for the area. You climb up through a dihedral using the slopey holds on either side of the arêtes. There is a bit of a runout between bolts 1 and 2 and since most of the holds feel slopey this may feel hard for the grade if you aren't a fan of slopers.
content.location: This route is on the arête as you turn the corner to access the trail to the top of the cliff.

content.description: Start on a boulder and pull the low mantle which is the crux.  Once you are on top of the mantle you move into much easier climbing but you have to compete with some vegetation for some of the holds. Some may want to start from the ground and avoid the boulder which adds a few difficult moves to get up to the mantle.  Stick clip the 2nd bolt to keep from cratering on the low crux.
content.location: This route is towards the end of the Northside and is the 1st route on the cliff that is offset from the main wall.  It is easily identifiable by the low mantle and the boulder that marks the start of the route.

content.description: A great first 5.8/5.9 sport climb. Move up dead vertical stone past a flake up to a huge ledge and then to the anchors. This would be awesome if it were another 80ft or so of climbing! This one is really easy to top-rope so use draws if you do to save the anchors.
Low intro crux of Epoxia to moderate face climbing up to the roof then things get really burly pulling over the roof on small slotted crimps to the anchor clip at the lip.
content.protection:
Bolts and Anchors 

Rebolted with Stainless Glue-Ins (2017 ARCC Rebolt)
content.location: Same start as Epoxia

content.description: Pull through a baby roof below the first bolt and jump into hard 5.10 climbing that leads to an in your face crux guarding the anchors. It isn't a bad idea to stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: Just to the left of the crack "Gurly Man"

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt and start on top of the boulder at the base. Good crimps up the the first bolt lead into an improbable looking blank section. Power through to the 2nd bolt and prepare for a tricky traverse (right) into Scarlet Begonias. Easier moves up into the roof lead to the chains.
content.protection: 2 glue-ins, 1 perma draw, bolt anchor w/chains and biners
content.location: Just right of Dorsal Recumbent. Look for the 5’ tall boulder near the wall that you start on and the perma draw towards the top that is shared by Scarlet Begonias.

content.description: Crux is right at third bolt.  Either try to clip from stanceless position then pull crux, or launch through to big jug on right and clip from there.
content.location: This is currently the second bolted route from left on Copperhead Wall.

content.description: This one is strenuous and hard to find/place gear on. I would think you should be a solid 5.10+ trad leader to try to lead this but I could be wrong. Pulling over the roof may be tough but since there are no anchor bolts on it you have to if you lead it.
content.location: To the right of Hung in the Fence

content.description: Power through beginning on good iron deposit holds that can be a little dirty.  Crux is going from first to second bolt.  Look for last bolt to the right of final roof feature (shared bolt).
content.location: This route is located to the right of Your Dad - it's the third route to the right of Triple Token.  Start on overhung iron deposits.

content.description: Interesting, albeit a bit contrived climbing leads through a tricky crux. Fun and technical.
content.location: Bolted line to the right of Arachnophobia.

content.description: A powerful start leads to better holds but pumpy climbing for a redpoint crux at the end.
content.protection: Bolts and Anchors*Rebolted with Stainless Glue-Ins (2017 ARCC Rebolt)
content.location: The route to the left of 13 crack, shares first two bolts with The Last Hurrah

climbs.name: Dorsal Recumbant
climbs.fa: FFA Scott Fitzgerald; FA Howard Doss & David Thoma

content.description: Classic hard route for NWA on amazing stone and very interesting powerful and technical movement. Starts off a boulder scramble with (suggested) 1st bolt stick clipped. Make powerful and fun moves on positive holds, laybacks to good clip with kneebar. It is helpful to have a long sling or double draw hanging on the 4th bolt which can be clipped from this kneebar. 2 options for crux: (1) Head straight up as the first ascensionist(s) on painful and thin finger-lock pinch and crimp moves or figure out the rad sequence to move left and then dyno to a good jug and clip the last bolt.
content.protection:
Wave bolts and SS Anchors. 

  (Rebolted 2017 ARCC)
content.location: Starts left of Howards Route and right of black water streak project on a boulder scramble at base.

content.description: Pull some small ledges and layback off the obvious orange flake.  The crux is pulling the small roof above the flake and then you follow good holds up to a slopey finish just below the chains.
content.protection: 4 Bolts plus a bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Wedged between 2 natural routes, this route features an obvious orange flake that is unmistakable.

content.description: Steep juggy start under large blocks is the crux. Clip one more bolt and dance to the top.
content.location: On the far right side of Testicle Fortitude Wall, starting under a blocky roof, just to the right of Crystal Method (10d) and left of Monarch (7).

content.description: Crux probably the overhang. I saw the bolted route but its not on Mountain Project so I thought Id help a climber out.
content.protection: Spotter and pads for the first bolt
content.location: Left of Defying Physics, the words “Crystal Method” are carved into the start. Pretty dope no lie.

content.description: This is the easier version of Halloween Town - veer left after second bolt, following easist path.
content.location: Shares first two bolts with Halloween Town, and anchors.

content.description: Sit start and climb straight up
content.location: Boulder to the right of Your Mom and Your Dad

content.description: This short overhung route is the first climb you see on your left on the northside wall. Very overhung with a sustained upper half. There is now a 4th bolt on this one.
content.protection: 4 Bolts/ Chains for anchors.*Bolted with Stainless Glue-Ins (2017 ARCC Rebolt)
content.location: 1st route on the left on the 13 Wall

content.description: "Begin just right of Triple Technique. Power through the unprotected, hanging start and follow the path of least resistance to the top." - Cole Fennel, Arkansas Rock Climbing

This is the arete to the left of Lincoln It Up.  Use the arete.  Beware of loose block above third bolt - this has been cleaned but there is a large piece that is still hollow and suspect - avoid using this!  Also be careful of runout from third bolt to fourth.
content.protection: Four bolts and ring anchors - shares anchors with Golden Child
content.location: This is last route on Copperhead Wall, the right-most route, or the route left of Lincon It Up.  Follow the arete to anchors slightly left of climb.

content.description:
4-5 bolts to anchors. In the middle of the wall in the middle of the overhang between two cracks. Climbs through pockets and jugs.

 Climb up bouldery moves to a bolt. You can get one piece of gear before the bolt too. Move past the bolt placing suspect gear to gain better rock above. 

 *Note* I took a nice whipper on this one when a cam I placed ripped out of the chossy rock above the bolt. In the process of ripping out of the rock the cam decided to hit me in the head ,which caused bleeding, to teach me a lesson about placing a cam in shity rock. Run it out a bit more to get on the more bomber rock above. 10b?
content.location: Just to the right of Tafoni crack

content.description: Classic crimpy and technical route up the right side of the giant arrowhead shaped boulder across from the routes before the wall of 5.10s. This boulder is obvious upon entering the area.  Classic! Guidebook gives V6, probably a bit soft.

Good sustained movement all the way up. If 5.10a is your project level get on this route and try hard! For more info on the route, crag and area pick up a copy of Rock Climbing Arkansas guide book   amzn.to/1nu9OBL
content.location: Right of Paco's Taco

content.description: trad line just right of Monarch bolts.go up left facing dihedral.
One of the best v0 problems anywhere! Aesthetic, fun, and easy compression problem on a flake to a comfortable topout.
content.location: The finger shaped flake across from the sport route Arachniphobia, slightly downhill but visible from the base of the routes.

content.description: now two variations, left is easier on good holds, right requires  a bit more thought probably 5.8    odd features, not bad.
This is a devious route that can frustrate and piss you off if you don't climb it right. The holds and moves are there, trust me.
content.location: The first bolted climb you see past the over hung Tafoni wall.

content.description: This low-angle dihedral starts just right of Smeaglin' It Up. Scramble past a few blocks at the start.
content.location: Just right of Smeaglin' It Up.

content.description: An overhung crack leads to a high crux to bolted anchors.
content.location: You cant miss this crack on your left. To the right of the number 13 spray painted on the wall.

content.description: This is the main crag on the north side of Lake Lincoln. It runs east to west and generally faces south. Many routes are shaded, some are sunny. If you want to set up topropes, it's relatively easy to scramble around either side of the cliff to access the top.
